description: a(n) = number of partitions of n into an odd number of parts, the least being 2; also a(n+2) = number of partitions of n into an even number of parts, each >=2.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
maple: b:= proc(n, i, t) option remember; `if`(n=0, t, `if`(i<2, 0,       b(n, i-1, t) +`if`(i>n, 0, b(n-i, i, 1-t))))    end:a:= n-> b(n-2$2, 1):seq(a(n), n=0..80);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 27 2014
mathematica: b[n_, i_, t_] := b[n, i, t] = If[n==0, t, If[i<2, 0, b[n, i-1, t] + If[i>n, 0, b[n-i, i, 1-t]]]]; a[n_] := b[n-2, n-2, 1]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 80}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Apr 08 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
prog: (PARI) gf=sum(n=0, N,  q^(2*n+1)/prod(k=1,n, 1-q^(2*k)) * q^(2*n+1)/prod(k=1,n, 1-q^(2*k-1)) );concat([0], Vec(gf) ) \\ _Joerg Arndt_, Feb 27 2014
author: _Clark Kimberling_
